UpdateTaskExecutor - Interface in org.jtrim.concurrent

upgradeExecutor(TaskExecutor) - Static method in class org.jtrim.concurrent.TaskExecutors
Deprecated.
The behaviour of this method is somewhat surprising. You should rather use the upgradeToStoppable or the upgradeToUnstoppable method. Returns a TaskExecutorService which upgrades the specified TaskExecutor to provide all the features of a TaskExecutorService except that it is may or may not possible to shutdown the returned executor. Tasks submitted to the returned TaskExecutorService will be forwarded to the execute method of the specified TaskExecutor.

Shutting down the returned executor has no effect on the specified TaskExecutor, even if already implemented the TaskExecutorService interface.

upgradeToStoppable(TaskExecutor) - Static method in class org.jtrim.concurrent.TaskExecutors
Returns a TaskExecutorService which upgrades the specified TaskExecutor to provide all the features of a TaskExecutorService.
upgradeToUnstoppable(TaskExecutor) - Static method in class org.jtrim.concurrent.TaskExecutors
Returns a TaskExecutorService which upgrades the specified TaskExecutor to provide all the features of a TaskExecutorService except that the returned executer cannot be shut down.
